semantic_title: Donor Z Code Guidelines for Living Organ and Tissue Donation
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors influencing health status and contact with health services (Z00-Z99) > 9. Donor

content.full_text: Codes in category Z52, Donors of organs and tissues, are used for living individuals who are donating blood or other body tissue. These codes are for individuals donating for others, as well as for self-donations. They are not used to identify cadaveric donations. (Evidence: pg no: 101, L64-L66)
content.summary: Guidelines for using Z52 donor codes for living individuals donating blood or tissue, including donations for others and self-donations, but excluding cadaveric donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L64-L66)
key_concepts: Z52 category for donors of organs and tissues (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
Used for living individuals only (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
Includes blood and other body tissue donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
Covers donations for others and self-donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65-L66)
Not used for cadaveric donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L66)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z52 codes are used for living individuals who are donating blood or other body tissue (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes are specifically for living donors and cover various types of donations including blood and tissue (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z52 codes are for individuals donating for others, as well as for self-donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65-L66)
detailed_rules.explanation: The codes apply to both altruistic donations to other individuals and autologous donations for the patient's own future use (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65-L66)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Z52 codes are not used to identify cadaveric donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L66)
detailed_rules.explanation: These codes are exclusively for living donors and should not be applied to deceased donor situations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L66)
common_applications: Distinguishing living from deceased donor procedures
Proper coding for organ procurement encounters

workflow_steps: Step 1: Verify donor is a living individual
Step 2: Identify type of donation (blood, organ, tissue)
Step 3: Determine if donation is for others or self
Step 4: Confirm this is not a cadaveric donation
Step 6: Add any necessary procedure codes

code_ranges.description: Donors of organs and tissues (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
usage_rules: For living individuals donating blood or tissue (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
For donations to others and self-donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65-L66)
Not for cadaveric donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L66)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Living patient donates blood for general blood bank use
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Healthy adult presents to blood donation center for routine blood donation
step_by_step: Step 1: Confirm patient is living donor
Step 3: Confirm donation is for others (blood bank)
Step 4: Select appropriate Z52 code for blood donation
Step 5: Add procedure codes as needed

correct_coding.sequencing: Donor code as primary reason for encounter
correct_coding.rationale: Z52 codes used for living individuals donating blood for others (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65-L66)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Would not identify the donor status of the encounter
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Omitting donor code for donation encounters

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient donates blood for own upcoming surgery
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient presents for autologous blood donation in preparation for scheduled surgery
step_by_step: Step 1: Confirm patient is living donor
Step 5: Consider adding codes for upcoming procedure if relevant

correct_coding.rationale: Z52 codes apply to self-donations as well as donations for others (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65-L66)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Would not capture the donation aspect of the encounter
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Focusing on upcoming surgery rather than current donation

procedure_links.note: Procedure codes may be needed in addition to donor Z codes

warnings: Do not use Z52 codes for cadaveric donations (Evidence: pg no: 101, L66)
Only use for living donors (Evidence: pg no: 101, L65)
best_practices: Verify donor is living before using Z52 codes
Consider both donations for others and self-donations
Add appropriate procedure codes when applicable
common_mistakes: Using donor codes for cadaveric donations
Omitting donor codes for donation encounters
Not recognizing self-donations as appropriate for Z52 codes
tips: Remember that autologous donations qualify for Z52 codes
Distinguish between living and cadaveric donor situations
Consider what type of donation is being performed
implementation_notes: Codes apply to various types of donations
Both altruistic and autologous donations are included
clinical_context: Living organ donor evaluations and procedures
